subject: Colleges and Universities
lead_paragraph: A father and son from Paramus, N.J., have been charged with lying to the police about a motor vehicle accident that killed a University of North Carolina student who was the mascot for the university’s basketball team. Authorities said Friday that Gagik Hovsepyan, 52, was covering for his son, Armen, 25, when he told the police last March that he was driving the car that struck the student, Jason Kendall Ray, as he was walking along Route 4 in Fort Lee. Armen Hovsepyan, whose driver’s license was suspended at the time of the accident, was actually behind the wheel, authorities say.
